alert.note: Alert for Dorchester (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 23 at 4:37PM EDT until July 23 at 5:15PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM EDT FOR PORTIONS OF CHARLESTON AND DORCHESTER COUNTIES... At 437 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over West Ashley, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and powerlines. Locations impacted include: North Charleston, Summerville, West Ashley, I-26/I-526 Interchange, Downtown Charleston, James Island, Johns Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Charleston Airport, Magnolia Gardens, Maybank Bridge and Charles Towne Landing. This warning includes the following interstates: I-26 between mile markers 213 and 218. I-526 between mile markers 11 and 19. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Continuous cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Move indoors immediately. Lightning is one of nature`s leading killers. Remember, if you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so.
